long: Meaning: to "clatter", i.e. "slap" (the hands together), "clang" (an instrument); by analogy, to "drive" (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to "become bondsman" by handclasping).  Usage: blow (a trumpet), cast, clap, fasten, pitch (tent), smite, sound, strike, Ã— suretiship, thrust.  Source: a primitive root;
